lead_paragraph: Indiana's Paul George scored all seven of his second-half points in the final 71 seconds Monday night and Monta Ellis made two free throws with 20.6 seconds left to seal an 89-87 victory over the Los Angeles Lakers.

headline.print_headline: George's Big Finish Leads Pacers Past Lakers 89-87
headline.main: George's Big Finish Leads Pacers Past Lakers 89-87
